title: Swap
content: The compared element is larger than the pivot, so we swap the place of these items

title: Don't Swap
content: The compared element is smaller than the pivot, the items remain in their place

title: Swap
content: The compared element is smaller than the pivot, so we swap the place of these items

title: Don't Swap
content: The compared element is larger than the pivot, the items remain in their place

title: Choose the pivot
content: First of all, we select a pivot. This is an element that we will use to make future comparisons

title: Compare against first element
content: Now that we have the comparison item, we then compare this item to see if the first element is larger or smaller than the item

title: Compare larger elements
content: We then compare the pivot with the right most, non-checked element to see if it's bigger or not. We recursively do this until all elements are checked

title: First run done
content: We've now made effectively three 'sub' lists. All the elements left of the pivot (the smaller elements), the pivot (a single element that is actually in the correct place in the list) and all the elements right of thhe pivot (the larger items). We then start again with step 1 with the smaller list

title: Currently using Quick Sort
content: This is a sort that partitions an list into two parts (based on a pivot), then sorts the parts independently.
